result.execSummary:
The defendant Rania M Hamad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, assessments, surcharges and/or restitution be paid cash bail to apply.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

-No driving unless valid drivers license.
-No driving if prescriptions stated on directions.

-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY- unless used as prescribed.
-Random Urine Screens.

Defendant Rania M Hamad in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: tmk
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made Helmi H.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction; with credit for 7 DAYS served.  

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, assessments, surcharges and/or restitution be paid cash bail to apply.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY- unless used as prescribed.
-Random Urine Screens
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-No driving unless valid drivers license.
-No driving if prescriptions stated on directions. 
-Other counseling needs to be determined.

The defendant is advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
